6-02-1996 10:49AM JUK- 1-38 MON 3:18 PM BAGATELOS&FADEN
FROM __ 0000006
P. 2
FAX NO. 415+582+1085 P. 2 :selected:
BARRY FADEM PETER A GARATELOS
LAW OFFICES OF BAGATELOS & FADEM THE INTERNATIONAL BUILDING GOI CALIFORNIA STREET SUITE 1410 SAN FRANCISCO, CALIFORNIA 84108
June 1, 1998
TELEPHONE
(415) 082-7100
baglan@ Bol.non (415) 902-1045 E-MAIL FAX
MEMORANDUM
To:
Grant Gillham
From:
Barry Fadem BF
Re:
Ballot Pamphlet Materials and Ballot Label
As we discussed at our last meeting. attached to this memorandum are the following documents: (1) Title and Summary :selected:
This document is prepared by the Attorney General and is limited to 100 words. I have included a copy of the title and summary that was prepared by the Attorney General for the Reiner petition (dated December 10, 1997). As we discussed, the Attorney General will prepare a new title and summary if the Reiner initiative qualifies for the ballot.
(2) Analysis by the Legislative Analyst
This document is prepared by the Legislative Analyst. I have included a copy of the analysis that was prepared by the Legislative Analyst for the Reiner petition (dated November 21, 1997). As we discussed, the legislative Analyst will prepare a new analysis if the Reiner initiative qualifies for the ballot.
(3) Ballot Argumenis
Each side of an initiative is permitted to write a primary argument (limited to 500 words)and a rebuttal argument (limited to 250 words). For illustrative purposes. I have included copies of the arguments relative to Proposition 226 so you can see how they will appear in the voter pamphlet.
(4) Proposition Summary
The summary utilized in the voter pamphlet is the ballot label prepared by the Attorney General's office without the words "yes" and "no". For illustrative purposes. I have included the summary for Proposition 226.
(5) What Your Vote Means
2065450055 :unselected: :unselected: :selected:

paragraphs.content: LAW OFFICES OF BAGATELOS & FADEM THE INTERNATIONAL BUILDING GOI CALIFORNIA STREET SUITE 1410 SAN FRANCISCO, CALIFORNIA 84108
Ballot Pamphlet Materials and Ballot Label
As we discussed at our last meeting. attached to this memorandum are the following documents: (1) Title and Summary

This document is prepared by the Attorney General and is limited to 100 words. I have included a copy of the title and summary that was prepared by the Attorney General for the Reiner petition (dated December 10, 1997). As we discussed, the Attorney General will prepare a new title and summary if the Reiner initiative qualifies for the ballot.

This document is prepared by the Legislative Analyst. I have included a copy of the analysis that was prepared by the Legislative Analyst for the Reiner petition (dated November 21, 1997). As we discussed, the legislative Analyst will prepare a new analysis if the Reiner initiative qualifies for the ballot.

Each side of an initiative is permitted to write a primary argument (limited to 500 words)and a rebuttal argument (limited to 250 words). For illustrative purposes. I have included copies of the arguments relative to Proposition 226 so you can see how they will appear in the voter pamphlet.

The summary utilized in the voter pamphlet is the ballot label prepared by the Attorney General's office without the words "yes" and "no". For illustrative purposes. I have included the summary for Proposition 226.
